lifespan.label: Potential Life Expectancy Increase
lifespan.evidenceTitle: Healthy Lifestyle Factors and Life Expectancy
lifespan.citation: Li Y, Pan A, Wang DD, et al. (2018). Impact of Healthy Lifestyle Factors on Life Expectancies in the US Population. Circulation, 138(4):345-355.
lifespan.finding: Following 5 low-risk lifestyle factors (never smoking, healthy BMI, regular physical activity, moderate alcohol intake, high-quality diet) was associated with a 12-14 year increase in life expectancy at age 50 compared to those following none of these factors.

control.label: Of how you age is in your control
control.citation: Kaplanis J, et al. (2018). Quantitative analysis of population-scale family trees with millions of relatives. Science, 360(6385):171-175.
control.finding: Genetic factors account for only 20-30% of longevity variation. The remaining 70-80% is attributed to modifiable lifestyle and environmental factors, demonstrating the profound impact of daily choices on healthspan and lifespan.

evidence.label: Scientific Evidence Based
evidence.citation: BiohackHer Research Database (2024). Peer-reviewed studies from PubMed, Cochrane Library, and women's health journals.
evidence.finding: All protocol recommendations are derived from 500+ peer-reviewed studies specifically focused on women's health, longevity, and hormonal optimization. Each recommendation is linked to primary research evidence.

lis.quote: I discovered I was aging 8 years faster than my chronological age. After following my protocol for 3 months, my LIS score improved from 58 to 74. I feel like I've reversed the clock.
lis.author: Sarah M., 47, Sydney

nutrition.quote: My nutrition score was 51â€”I had no idea I was missing so much. The supplement protocol fixed my energy crashes and brain fog within 2 weeks. Game changer.
nutrition.author: Emma L., 52, Melbourne

hormone.quote: The Hormone Compass helped me understand my perimenopause symptoms weren't 'just stress.' The targeted protocol reduced hot flashes by 80% in 6 weeks.
hormone.author: Lisa K., 49, Brisbane

categoryDescriptions.poor: Your assessment indicates significant challenges with {{assessmentName}} that are likely impacting your daily quality of life. These results suggest that professional support could be highly beneficial in developing targeted strategies for improvement.
categoryDescriptions.poorAreas: The areas showing the greatest impact are: {{areas}}. Addressing these specific aspects could lead to substantial improvements in your overall wellbeing.
categoryDescriptions.fair: Your results show that {{assessmentName}} is affecting various aspects of your life to a moderate degree. While you're managing some areas well, there's meaningful room for improvement that could significantly enhance your daily experience.
categoryDescriptions.fairFocus: Focus particularly on: {{areas}}. Targeted interventions in these areas, combined with the toolkit recommendations below, can help you move toward optimal wellbeing.
categoryDescriptions.fairStrengths: You're already doing well with: {{strengths}}. These strengths can serve as a foundation as you work on other areas.
categoryDescriptions.good: Your assessment shows that you're managing {{assessmentName}} well overall. You've developed effective strategies that are working for you, though there are still opportunities for optimization.
categoryDescriptions.goodStrengths: Your particular strengths lie in: {{strengths}}. Maintaining these positive habits while addressing minor areas for improvement can help you reach excellent outcomes.
categoryDescriptions.goodAreas: Small refinements in: {{areas}} could elevate your results to the excellent range.
categoryDescriptions.excellent: Outstanding results! You've developed highly effective strategies for managing {{assessmentName}}. Your approach is working exceptionally well, and you're experiencing optimal outcomes in this area of health.
categoryDescriptions.excellentStrengths: You excel particularly in: {{strengths}}. These successful strategies could be valuable templates for optimizing other areas of your health journey.
categoryDescriptions.excellentMaintain: Focus on maintaining these positive habits and consider exploring the evidence-based tools below to sustain and further enhance your wellbeing.

memory.title: Enhance Memory Function
memory.description: Try cognitive exercises like learning a new language or musical instrument. Consider omega-3 supplementation and prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep, as memory consolidation occurs during deep sleep stages.

focus.title: Improve Focus and Attention
focus.description: Implement the Pomodoro Technique (25-minute focused work sessions). Reduce screen time before tasks requiring concentration. Consider meditation practice starting with 5-10 minutes daily to build attention span.

anxiety.title: Manage Anxiety and Stress
anxiety.description: Practice daily breathing exercises (4-7-8 technique). Consider cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for lasting change. Regular aerobic exercise (30 mins, 5x/week) significantly reduces anxiety symptoms. Limit caffeine intake after midday.

mood.title: Support Emotional Wellbeing
mood.description: Maintain consistent sleep-wake times to regulate mood. Ensure daily sunlight exposure, especially in morning. Regular social connection is crucial - schedule weekly catch-ups. Consider journaling to process emotions.

sleep.title: Optimize Sleep Quality
sleep.description: Establish a consistent sleep schedule (same bedtime/wake time daily). Create a cool, dark bedroom (65-68Â°F). Avoid screens 1 hour before bed. Consider magnesium glycinate supplementation 1-2 hours before sleep.

energy.title: Boost Energy Levels
energy.description: Check iron and B12 levels through bloodwork. Eat balanced meals every 3-4 hours to maintain stable blood sugar. Take short walking breaks every 90 minutes. Stay hydrated (aim for 64-96 oz water daily).

pain.title: Address Physical Discomfort
pain.description: Incorporate daily gentle stretching or yoga. Consider physical therapy assessment for persistent pain. Anti-inflammatory diet (increase omega-3s, reduce processed foods). Apply heat/cold therapy as appropriate.

cognitive.title: Enhance Cognitive Processing
cognitive.description: Stay mentally active with puzzles, reading, or learning new skills. Ensure adequate hydration throughout the day. Consider checking thyroid function and vitamin D levels. Regular aerobic exercise improves processing speed.

professional.title: Seek Professional Guidance
professional.description: Given your current results, consulting with a healthcare professional can provide personalized assessment and treatment options. They can rule out underlying conditions and create a tailored intervention plan.

maintain.title: Maintain Your Strengths
maintain.description: You're performing well in: {{strengths}}. Continue these positive habits while addressing other areas. Your success here demonstrates your capacity for positive health changes.

general.title: Continue Your Health Journey
general.description: Explore our evidence-based toolkit for science-backed interventions tailored to your specific needs. Small, consistent changes compound over time for significant improvements.

toolkit.description: Evidence-based biohacking tools tailored to your assessment results

lisResults.sharedTitle: Someone Shared Their Results With You!
lisResults.sharedDesc: Take your own free assessment to get personalized longevity insights.
lisResults.pageSubtitle: Your personalized health assessment and longevity profile
lisResults.scoreMeasure: A comprehensive measure of your current healthspan and longevity potential
lisResults.bioAgeExplanation: Biological age is an indicator of how well your body may be functioning at a cellular level. This assessment uses lifestyle factors to provide an indicative biological age estimate. Chronological age is simply the number of years you've been alive. Your lifestyle choices, stress levels, sleep quality, and nutrition can make your body function younger or older than your calendar age.
lisResults.in5Years: In 5 years you'll be {{age}} years old
lisResults.in20Years: In 20 years you'll be {{age}} years old
lisResults.improvementPotential: Improvement Potential: {{years}} years younger biological age
lisResults.reductionPercent: That's a {{percent}}% reduction in biological aging over 5 years!
lisResults.turningBackClock: That's like turning back the clock by gaining {{years}} extra years of vitality
lisResults.calculationBasis: Calculation basis: Optimized scenario assumes achieving an LIS score of 85 through evidence-based biohacking interventions. Your current aging rate: {{rate}}x per year.
lisResults.bioAgeDisclaimer: Your Longevity Impact Score is an estimation based on self-reported lifestyle factors and health behaviors. While this assessment provides valuable insights into your longevity trajectory, it is not a substitute for clinical testing. For a more accurate cellular-level biological age measurement, we recommend taking a clinical test including comprehensive blood work, inflammation markers, metabolic panels, and hormonal assessments.
